title: Is anyone else feeling physically ill over how long they have to wait for Swain?
body:
I am literally losing sleep here and feeling like trash over how long I have to wait and endure to finally play my Glorious General. Last Roadmap broke my hype meter and now all that's left is suffering and the immeasurable pain of Swain not being revealed. I am like a wounded raven, bleeding and unable to take flight.

Any advice on how to suffer less?

replies.body:
> Is anyone else feeling physically ill over how long they have to wait for Swain?

Yes.

> Any advice on how to suffer less?

No.
I speak as a fan, not a rioter (I didn't have anything to do with the rework directly) -- I am in the same boat as you, and it IS suffering. I feel like tearing my hair out.

You're gonna be my new friend, amigo. Say, are you allowed to pitch champion change ideas to the people ahead of champ design? Btw, if you want to torture yourself further, create a swain main account in countdown of his release

Honestly, the champs (and champ update) team folks have been killing it -- my contribution is via the Worldbuilding team, so we'd have conversations about how the update or new champs will relate to what's established for Runeterra, and how we can sync designs up :) Like in Swain's case, we talked about options to make Swain jive with the new Noxian look instead of the weird green robe he had on before, and then they went off and came up with the amazeballs in the teaser. I take the stance of, "these guys know what they're doing so my ideas are going to be like selling ice to eskimos". The iteration and thought they go through is inspiring and incredible, and I'd hazard to say I wouldn't want to throw a wrench in their engines. 

That said, are there some burning ideas you have for champion changes? What's burnin' a hole in ya?

These knights are like Quinn & Valor on steroids — big, armored Demacian dudes with avian companions whose trust they’ve earned only through tons of training and companionship. IIRC, they’re also the most elite soldiers in the Demacian military, which means if Quinn were ever to become one, it would push her “rags to riches” / “commoner to commander” narrative even further while also preserving what's already unique and core to her character (Demacian scout with a close relationship to a bird companion). 

Anyway, this is probably something you guys have already thought about, and apologies for going off-topic from Swain, just thought I’d mention it anyway because I think the idea has a lot of potential =)

I don't want anything really, I trust Riot because I've seen what you guys are capable of. But as one sufferer to another, can I ask for a tiny little bit of information: In the current state of Noxus lore, how much consideration has been given to Vladimir & the blood cults? I see lore team people sharing their headcanons about their favorite characters all the time, but no one has really given any flavour on my boy Vlad. 
This means they either have something mindblowingly awesome in store or are just not that bothered at all. Which one is it?

The answer is yes -- there's been some development there. However! The real answer is a bit more nuanced. To give you a bit of context, Worldbuilding tends to focus more on the holistic, overall principles of a region while the essence of champions we trust the champ team to dive into. So while the answer is yes, more specifically the thinking is on blood mages and how they fit into and interact with the rest of Noxian society and armies, and less on Vlad himself. 

Also I don't mean to hype you even more but from a worldbuilding standpoint another reason I'm so effing excited for Swain is because I personally feel like he's the embodiment of the leader Noxus has always deserved. The faction kinda grew up over the years and old Swain felt like he needed to be updated to fit it, too. AND HE HAS.

Ma boy Swain returning from 2010 to take his rightful place in Noxus is what it is to me.

I have lived in three countries and I have never felt as much patriotism towards any of them as I do towards Noxus. I felt Swain's old lore and VO were like a leaky dish that failed to capture and retain the greatness of my nation. I can only tear up with patriotic pride as I read this in the company of my numerous Noxus posters and beautiful raven statuette.

This is making me excited, I can't wait to see how his character will be after the update, and I hope gameplay will hold up (and I hope he'll have a gameplay I actually like, I'd be sad if he played a way that I don't find interesting).
About blood mages: I really liked the release of Sion's update, is all that lore stuff still canon? There were especially Swain, LeBlanc and Vlad involved, and those are three very old champs that I could see being updated and changed sooner or later...
Honestly, I'd love to see J4 and Xin get this treatment as they are the least Demacian looking demacian

Ive got a burning idea ive had on my mind for a while so im glad a rioter actually asked about somthing like this! 

So an idea thats been on my mind is for Akali when she finally gets her VGU. Firstly Akali in comparison to her other counterparts Shen and Kennen is relatively bland. Shen wields a Spirit Blade, Kennen was born with Boundless Energy and speed and Akali is just....a ninja. This has been on my mind for years and Daniel Z Klein said it best months ago in what he would do if he was to rework her and the first thing he said was to think up a way to show where she draws her power from. With the name 'Fist of Shadow' you would assume she would be more then just a regular green ninja girl but Akali technically doesnt really have a power. Her mini Scythes have always been a standard part of who she is but maybe they can be expressed better or changed into different weapons altogether. Somthing like Shadow Blades/Shadow Scythes either handed down through her clan over the years for the next Fist of Shadow or weapons found similar to Zeds forbidden technique that shows where she draws her power from in her new kit with the idea of say duality behind them. That leads to my next idea...

Over the years theres always been tons of speculation of Akali and whats her connection to Zed and his order. With Kayn coming out recently as a student of Zed an idea that could help fit her thematically in her VGU is that Akali was a former student of Zed and one of his most prized students and had her shadow blades/scythes passed down to her by him and maybe went rogue on Zeds order or maybe even was working undercover in Zeds order purposely. Something that ties it all together between all of them since we know what happened between Zed and Shen. I think something like this could really open up about her general power, where her intentions going forward and previously lie and could give some great dialogue between her, Zed, Shen, Kayn and Kennen. 

These are just some rough thoughts though but just some stuff on my mind.
